page.title: 14THE SEWAGE FARM
page.content:
There is a sewage treatment plant in Pigeon House Lane, which is a very old lane between Church Hanborough and Freeland. The plant is well hidden on a west facing slope at GR 423128.
It cleans the sewage for an area stretching from North Leigh to Bladon At the top of the slope are large rectangular filter beds, and after going through these the sewage is then sprayed onto circular filters through a spray that rotates. The cleaned water flows out at the bottom of the site into an open stream where fish live, and which flows east into the Evenlode. The man who works there showed us a bottle of the cleaned water. He said it was drinkable, but it was yellow and it would probably give us a tummy upset.
